summary: Lagos, Nigeria's largest city, is a bustling hub with a population of around 21 million. It was once the country's capital but is now the economic center, influencing African commerce and culture. The city originated in the 15th century as an Awori settlement, later becoming part of the Benin Empire. Lagos is divided into islands and the mainland, with the city expanding rapidly. It's one of the world's fastest-growing cities, featuring a busy seaport and a significant financial center. The city boasts the University of Lagos and iconic sites like Tinubu Square and Murtala Muhammed International Airport.
title: Lagos
